name: Charles S. EVERETTE, Sr., Administrator of the Estate of Charles S. Everette, Jr., Deceased, Appellee, v. CITY OF NEW KENSINGTON, a municipal corporation, Appellant
name_abbreviation: Everette v. City of New Kensington

judges: Before EAGEN, C. J., and O’BRIEN, ROBERTS, NIX, MANDERINO, LARSEN and FLAHERTY, JJ.
parties: Charles S. EVERETTE, Sr., Administrator of the Estate of Charles S. Everette, Jr., Deceased, Appellee, v. CITY OF NEW KENSINGTON, a municipal corporation, Appellant.

opinions.text:
OPINION
PER CURIAM:
The petition for allowance of appeal having been improvidently granted, the appeal is dismissed.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM:

attorneys: Chester S. Fossee, Murovich, Reale & Fossee, Pittsburgh, for appellant.
Daniel M. Berger, Pittsburgh, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
406 A.2d 750
Charles S. EVERETTE, Sr., Administrator of the Estate of Charles S. Everette, Jr., Deceased, Appellee, v. CITY OF NEW KENSINGTON, a municipal corporation, Appellant.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued Sept. 18, 1979.
Decided Oct. 23, 1979.
Chester S. Fossee, Murovich, Reale & Fossee, Pittsburgh, for appellant.
Daniel M. Berger, Pittsburgh, for appellee.
Before EAGEN, C. J., and O’BRIEN, ROBERTS, NIX, MANDERINO, LARSEN and FLAHERTY, JJ.
